mean_cn: v. 使屈辱，抑制，苦修，约束
mean_en: to cause (someone) to feel very embarrassed and foolish
word_etyma: mort死+ify...化→使人想死→羞辱[别人]
short_phrase: The dinner mortifies the little girl.
sentence: She was mortified to learn that she had to eat a whole, live octopus for lunch.
sentence_trans: 她痛苦的发现她必须要吃掉一整只活章鱼当午餐。
